algorithm_technique: Sliding window with frequency tracking and a sorted list to maintain top x elements.
Maintain counts and use a sorted list of (frequency, value) pairs to efficiently find top x.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the x-sum for all subarrays of length k, where x-sum considers top x frequent elements.
problem_summary_technical: Sliding window maintains element counts; SortedList tracks top x frequent elements (with tie-breaking by value) for x-sum calculation.
key_insights: This problem is identical in logic to 'find-x-sum-of-all-k-long-subarrays-i' but with larger constraints.
The use of SortedList is crucial for handling the dynamic updates of top x elements efficiently.
The tie-breaking rule (larger value is more frequent) is handled by storing negative values in the SortedList.
